items.title: How we built Agent Builder's memory system
items.summary: LangChain describes their implementation of a memory system for Agent Builder, covering the technical architecture and rationale for prioritizing persistent memory in agent workflows.

items.title: Agent Observability Powers Agent Evaluation
items.summary: LangChain emphasizes that reliable agent development requires understanding agent reasoning through observability and systematic evaluation approaches.

items.title: 0-Days: Evaluating and mitigating the growing risk of LLM-discovered vulnerabilities
items.summary: Claude Opus 4.6 demonstrates significant capability in finding high-severity vulnerabilities in well-tested codebases by reading and reasoning about code like human researchers. Anthropic has found over 500 high-severity vulnerabilities in open source software using Claude.

items.title: Context-Bench: A benchmark for agentic context engineering
items.summary: Letta Research introduces Context-Bench, a benchmark measuring agents' ability to perform filesystem operations, entity relationship tracing, and skill discovery/loading from libraries.

items.title: zeitzeuge — AI-Powered Performance Analysis for Web & Tests
items.summary: A performance analysis tool that uses a LangChain Deep Agent to autonomously analyze V8 heap snapshots, Chrome runtime traces, and CPU profiles to suggest code-level fixes.

items.title: Programmatic tool calling
items.summary: Claude API introduces programmatic tool calling, allowing Claude to write Python code that calls tools within a code execution container, reducing latency and token consumption for multi-tool workflows.

items.title: Improved Web Search with Dynamic Filtering
items.summary: Claude's web search and web fetch tools now automatically write and execute code to filter search results before they reach the context window, improving accuracy by 11% and reducing token usage by 24%.

items.title: How to Use Memory in Agent Builder
items.summary: LangChain's Agent Builder incorporates memory that retains user feedback, corrections, and preferences to improve agent performance over time.

items.title: IBM and UC Berkeley Diagnose Why Enterprise Agents Fail Using IT-Bench and MAST
items.summary: IBM and UC Berkeley developed IT-Bench and MAST to diagnose why enterprise agents fail.

items.title: New in Agent Builder: all new agent chat, file uploads + tool registry
items.summary: LangChain's Agent Builder has been updated with new agent chat capabilities, file upload support, and a tool registry feature.

items.title: monday Service + LangSmith: Building a Code-First Evaluation Strategy from Day 1
items.summary: Monday Service shares their approach to building a code-first evaluation strategy for customer-facing service agents using LangSmith, demonstrating production evaluation practices for agent systems.

items.title: Improving Deep Agents with harness engineering
items.summary: LangChain's coding agent improved from Top 30 to Top 5 on Terminal Bench 2.0 through harness engineering techniques including self-verification and tracing, showing practical agent performance optimization methods.

items.title: Introducing Lockdown Mode and Elevated Risk labels in ChatGPT
items.summary: OpenAI introduces Lockdown Mode and Elevated Risk labels in ChatGPT to help organizations defend against prompt injection and AI-driven data exfiltration in agent deployments.

items.title: On Agent Frameworks and Agent Observability
items.summary: LangChain discusses the evolving role of agent frameworks as LLMs improve, emphasizing that agents are systems around models that still require frameworks for orchestration and observability.

items.title: Custom Kernels for All from Codex and Claude
items.summary: Hugging Face introduces custom CUDA kernels as agent skills, allowing agents to leverage Codex and Claude for specialized computational tasks and performance optimization.

items.title: Gemini 3 Deep Think: Advancing science, research and engineering
items.summary: Google introduces Gemini 3 Deep Think with specialized reasoning capabilities designed for complex science, research and engineering challenges that agents might tackle.

items.title: Introducing GPT-5.3-Codex-Spark
items.summary: OpenAI releases GPT-5.3-Codex-Spark, a real-time coding model with 15x faster generation and 128k context, enabling more efficient code generation for agents.

items.title: OpenEnv in Practice: Evaluating Tool-Using Agents in Real-World Environments
items.summary: Hugging Face presents OpenEnv, a framework for evaluating tool-using agents in real-world environments, addressing the critical need for agent benchmarking.

items.title: Harness engineering: leveraging Codex in an agent-first world
items.summary: OpenAI discusses leveraging Codex in an 'agent-first world' for harness engineering, indicating practical applications of code-generation models in agent architectures. This explores how code generation capabilities integrate with agent development workflows.

items.title: The two patterns by which agents connect sandboxes
items.summary: LangChain explores two key architectural patterns for connecting AI agents to sandbox environments where they can execute code, install packages, and maintain persistent workspaces.
